intro: Pellionia minutiflora, commonly known as the small-flowered pellionia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettle and related plants. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some horticultural settings for its attractive foliage and subtle blooms.
